parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To stone, pelt with stones. From lithos; to lapidate.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To saw, saw through. A strengthened form of a primary prio; to saw in two.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A sword. Probably feminine of a presumed derivative of mache; a knife, i.e. Dirk; figuratively, war, judicial punishment.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From peri and erchomai; to come all around, i.e. Stroll, vacillate, veer.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A sheep's (sometimes pig's) hide, sheepskin. From melon; a sheep-skin.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Of a goat. From aix; belonging to a goat.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From husteros; to be later, i.e. to be inferior; generally, to fall short.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I make narrow (strictly: by pressure); I press upon, (b) I persecute, press hard. Akin to the base of tribos; to crowd.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To treat evilly, hurt, torment. From a presumed compound of kakos and echo; to maltreat.
